member.name: T:Gearset.GearConsole
member.summary: This is the main Gearset class. Provides wrapper methods for easily accessing the its components functionality.
member.remarks:
Create a single instance of this class in your game and keep it in a static variable you can reach with ease. (i.e Util.Console).
For 3D games, the Gearset camera matrices must be updated using the SetMatrices method.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game)
member.summary: Creates the GearConsole. if you want the console to draw 3D debug stuff you need to update the World/View/Projection matrices using the SetMatrices or setting them manually.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.Initialize
member.summary: Most resources are initialized here.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.SetMatrices(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary: Use this method after every Update of your game to update the camera matrices so 3D overlays can be drawn correctly.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Adds or modifiy a key without value on the overlaid tree view.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.Show(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds or modifies a key/value pair to the overlaid tree view.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.AddQuickAction(System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Adds an action button to the bottom of the game window.
member.param: Name of the action as it will appear on the button.
Action to perform when the button is clicked.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.Plot(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds the provided value to the plot with the provided plotName.
member.param: A name that represent a data set.
The value to add to the sampler

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.Plot(System.String,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the provided value to the plot with the provided plotName. At the same time modifies the history length of the sampler.
member.param: A name that represent a data set.
The value to add to the sampler
The number of samples that the sampler will remember at any given time.

member.name: M:Gearset.GearConsole.SetFinderSearchFunction(Gearset.SearchFunction)
member.summary: Sets the function that is used by Gearset when a query is written to the Finder by the user. It usually searches through your game objects and returns a collection of the ones whose name or Type matches the query. A search function receives a String and return IEnumerable (e.g. a List)

member.summary: True if the mouse was just released, last one frame true.

member.summary: True if mouse did a released-pressed-released cycle without moving the ClickThreshold.

member.summary: True if the mouse was just pressed, last one frame true.

member.summary: True if the mouse was just released, last one frame true.

member.summary: The mouse mave moved the ClickThreshold since it was pressed.

member.summary: The mouse just moved the threshold, this will only be true for one frame.

member.name: P:Gearset.Components.MouseComponent.ClickThreshold
member.summary: The distance the (down left) mouse can move without being considered a drag (still a click). Should be zero for PC games and some higher value for tablets.

member.name: P:Gearset.Components.MouseComponent.KeepMouseInWindow
member.summary: Set to true if the component should force the mouse to stay inside the client logger bounds.

member.name: P:Gearset.Components.MouseComponent.DragOffset

member.summary: Adds a single sample to the sampler of the specified name, if the sampler does not exists it will be created with the specified historyLength. This function is intended to be used with sampler that are not bound to a function.

member.summary: Returns true if the node is an ExtraNode, that means that it does not correspond to any field or property of the parent but is added as an extra control to better manipulate the parent.

member.summary: Will turn true when the user modify this property through the UI.

member.name: P:Gearset.Components.InspectorWPF.InspectorNode.Updating
member.summary: If true, the UI will be updated every frame to reflect the node value.

member.name: P:Gearset.Components.InspectorWPF.InspectorNode.Force
member.summary: If true, the value set in the UI will be set to this node every frame.

member.summary: If true, this node won't be shown in the inspector logger.

member.summary: If false, the "Cant write" icon won't be showed. This property is to be binded by WPF.

member.summary: The target object (always represented by the root of the tree) so it is looked up recursively.
